result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Edward McClurg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Non-Narcotics [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today April 1, 2016.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Probation may be transferred to Missouri.
Defendant is eligible for expungement under 973.015 upon successful completion of Probation.
Credit for 10 days if revoked.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file, balance to be refunded to payor.
DNA surcharge.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Brock M. or Noah D.
-Defendant ordered to comply with testifying fully and truthfully in these matters.
-Defendant to report to the jail today April 1, 2016 to provide a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment and/or therapy.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Matthew Krische, DF: Joseph Edward McClurg appeared.  Court called at 2:36 p.m.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads No Contest to the amended Ct 1.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudciated guilty of Ct 1.  Sentencing arguments.  DE makes statement.  Crt orders:

W/S 2 years probation with conditions
- Probation can be transferred to Missouri
- AODA and follow through with any recommended treatment or therapy  
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- It is hereby ordered, the defendant have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Brock M. Noah D..  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- 40 hours of community service and provide written proof of completion
- DE ordered to comply with testifying fully and truthfully in these matters
- Under 973.015 DE can request expungement after fully completing with probation
- DE to report to probation today 04/01/16
- DEs bond to remain in effect until the DE has signed up for probation and then vacated
- DE to go to jail to provide a DNA sample today 04/01/16
- Credit for 10 days credit revoked
- Court costs of $268.00 and $250.00 for the DNA Surcharge.  Apply money on file and balance to be sent back to the payor
- 20 days to appeal
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-01-2016 02:00 pm

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski, DF: Joseph Edward McClurg appeared. Court called at 2:39 p.m. Set for arraignment.  DE reviews the Information.  Court informs Def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty.  Not Guilty Plea is entered.  Attorney Kucinski argues bond.  Court modifies bond.  Bail is continued as modified.  Court adjourned at 2:41 p.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Arraignment at 08-24-2015 02:30 pm

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Joseph Edward McClurg appeared from jail.  Court called.  Set for Preliminary Hearing.  S/T of Investigator James Mikla of the St. Croix County Sheriff's Department.  Direct by ADA Nieskes.  DE is identified by Investigator Mikla.  Cross by Attorney Kucinski.  Court finds probable cause that a felony probably was committed and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Attorney Kucinski argues bond.  Court will consider after the arraignment.  Set out for arraignment.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned.  9:39 a.m. lw  Arraignment scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
signed by EJL 8/16/15. eif
